****************************************************************** Case Number: {!Case.CaseNumber} Issue Reported: {!Case.Description}
Hello,
After extensive testing, we've determined this to be a browser issue with older versions of Chrome and the Android browser.
Chrome 35 (OS X) is broken, Chrome 36+ works. This is occurring specifically for .uk domains which we've confirmed via testing on a .uk test store. It seems Chrome refuses to set a cookie on a .uk domain.
Chrome auto-updates itself for most people, so the problem will correct itself for Chrome. With the Android browser (which has much of the same codebase) we're not so lucky - some people maybe have to wait for an upgrade to their Android OS if they strictly use the built-in browser. Chrome for Android works fine.
I hope I've given you some visibility into our efforts to correct this issue - but ultimately it seems the issue exists outside BigCommerce. I'll keep an ear to the ground for any workarounds that may appear, but it seems your best recourse for the time being is to recommend customers upgrade their browser and/or use Chrome when on Android.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience . Let us know if you have further questions.
Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have further questions. Technical support is available 24/7:
BigCommerce Support http://support.bigcommerce.com
